DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate efficacy AIM 4 Teen Moms program increase use long-term contraceptive , improve adherence contraceptive prevent rapid repeat pregnancy among parent adolescent .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation Efficacy AIM ( Adult Identity Mentoring ) 4 Teen Moms Program
DOC.detailed_description: This study use randomize controlled design evaluate efficacy AIM ( Adult Identity Mentoring ) 4 Teen Moms reduce incidence rapid repeat pregnancy associate sexual risk behavior . The AIM 4 Teen Moms program combination individual small group session intervention encourage parent young woman age 15-19 year old delay rapid repeat pregnancy 24 month later . It consist seven individual 1-hour long session ( generally conduct participant 's home ) two 90-minute group session deliver 12 week period . Study participant adolescent mother receive service California 's Adolescent Family Life Cal-Learn program Los Angeles County area . There intervention deliver member control group . This study conduct part national Evaluation Adolescent Pregnancy Prevention Approaches fund U.S. Department Health Human Services ' Office Adolescent Health .
DOC.criteria: Beneficiaries California 's Adolescent Family Life CalLearn program Los Angeles County area Female 15 19 year old Has child age 1 6 month program start English Spanish speaker
